value.value: A porosity quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being capable of admitting the passage of gas or liquid through pores or interstices.
A physical quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's disposition to recover its size and shape after deformation in any way.
A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's length being notably higher than its width.
An elasticity quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's ability to recover its size and shape after deformation in any way.
A shape quality that obtains by virtue of the bearer having inward facing edges; having a surface or boundary that curves or bulges outward, as the exterior of a sphere.
A shape quality inhering in a colony by virtue of the bearer's appearing above the medium surface with terraced edges.
A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's terminating in a point or edge.
A physical quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's disposition to being turned, bowed, or twisted without breaking.
A size quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being made wider or larger in all dimensions.

definition.value: A size quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being made wider or larger in all dimensions. [database_cross_reference: WordNet:WordNet]

value.value: isometrical
A symmetry quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having equal dimensions or measurements.
A shape quality in which a portion of the outermost boundary of an entity folds in space such that a portion that was originally convex is now concave.
A shape quality in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's curving inward.
A convex 3-D shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting a consistently-sized round cross section.
A convex 3-D shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's resembling a cone (a 3-D shape with a round cross section that tapers).
A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having an empty space or cavity within.
perforate

definition.value: A structural quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having a hole or holes, especially a row or array of small holes. [database_cross_reference: answers.com:answers.com]

value.value: A quality inhering in a bearer that is shaped in the form of a fan.
cup-shaped

definition.value: A concave 3-D shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's shape form resembling the shape of a cup. [database_cross_reference: url:http://www.thefreedictionary.com/cup-shaped]

value.value: A tapered shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's tapering gradually to a sharp point.
A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's surface becoming more extended in a plane.

definition.value: Becoming flat but not necessarily completely flat.

value.value: exposed

definition.value: Open to view or not covered by another entity. [database_cross_reference: PATOC:WD]

value.value: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having a shape like a ring (a circular shape enclosing a space).
The bearer of this quality has_part n=2 of the indicated entity type, where n is unpaired for a comparable organism.
A light sensing organ composed of ommatidia.
stemma

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/IAO_00001.value:
Eye-spots which may be set into a pit to reduce the angles of light that enters and affects the eyespot, to allow the organism to deduce the angle of incoming light. 
[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stemma http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye#Pit_eyes]

value.value: Eye-spots which may be set into a pit to reduce the angles of light that enters and affects the eyespot, to allow the organism to deduce the angle of incoming light.
An eye with one concave chamber. Note that 'simple' does not imply a reduced level of complexity or acuity.

A cuticular covering that is composed primarily of chitin. The main structural component of arthropod cuticle is a polysaccharide, chitin, composed of N-acetylglucosamine units, together with proteins and lipids[WP].

Sense organ embedded in the integument and consisting of one or a cluster of sensory neurons and associated sensory structures, support cells and glial cells forming a single organised unit with a largely bona-fide boundary.[FBbt].

definition.value:
Region of integument of a tagma.
http://flybase.org/cgi-bin/fbcvq.html?query=FBbt:00007289
An entity that exists in full at any time in which it exists at all, persists through time while maintaining its identity and has no temporal parts.

value.value: b is a specifically dependent continuant = Def. b is a continuant & there is some independent continuant c which is not a spatial region and which is such that b s-depends_on c at every time t during the course of b’s existence. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [050-003])

definition.value: A continuant that inheres in or is borne by other entities. Every instance of A requires some specific instance of B which must always be the same.

value.value: b is a generically dependent continuant = Def. b is a continuant that g-depends_on one or more other entities. (axiom label in BFO2 Reference: [074-001])

definition.value: A continuant that is dependent on one or other independent continuant bearers. For every instance of A requires some instance of (an independent continuant type) B but which instance of B serves can change from time to time.

value.value: Creation and/or presentation of a published research object, such as books, journal articles, and other publications like technical documentation, web sites, code, ontologies, or data models.
Preparation, creation and/or presentation of figures for a manuscript, presentation or other use.

definition.value: Translating words or text from one language to another.
Includes literature searches and contributions to review activities (systematic reviews, scoping reviews, etc.)
Coordination of research dissemination through popular media and the press, as well as community outreach and liaising of project directly to the community.

value.value: Creation or refinement of a website, a set of related web pages served from a single web domain.
A communication role in which one records the details of an event, a process, a workflow, etc.
A communication role that utilizes the art or profession of using design elements (such as typography and images) to convey information, create visualizations, or create an effect.

definition.value: A role that encompasses effective and efficient operation and usage of data, including, but not limited to management, handling, or manipulation.
A role in which a person participates in the transfer of knowledge and skills, through teaching, development of educational materials or curriculum, through program development or other means.
Verification that software meets requirements; validation that software meets users' needs, identification of software bugs, assessment of software performance and usability.

value.value: A role related to creations of the mind, such as inventions; literary and artistic works; designs; and symbols, names and images used in commerce. from.

definition.value: Policy development generally involves research, analysis, consultation and synthesis of information to produce recommendations for action by an individual or an organization. It should also involve an evaluation of options against a set of criteria used to assess each option.

value.value: Set of activities aimed at prolonging the life of a record.

definition.value: Manage regulatory and compliance issues for the research project.
A person that is responsible for usage of instrumentation, such as equipment or devices, or instruments like a survey or questionnaire.
